items.description:
Registered speakers will be permitted to attend either in-person or remotely via the Zoom video conferencing platform. 

If you wish to view our full speakers procedures please visit: https://www.philasd.org/schoolboard/wp-content/uploads/sites/892/2021/08/005-Admin-Procedures-Aug-2021.pdf

Meeting Location: Remote Video Conference; Livestream available: https://www.philasd.org/pstv/watch/

Meeting materials can be found here.

Contact Information:
Phone: 215-400-5959
Email: schoolboard@philasd.org

Notice is hereby given that the Board of Education of The School District of Philadelphia shall hold an initial public hearing pursuant to the Charter School Law on the application for a new charter school in Philadelphia.  The hearing will be held on December 20, 2023 via remote platform.  The remote platform link will be posted on the Board of Education’s website at https://www.philasd.org/schoolboard/.

The hearing shall commence at 4:00 p.m.  The charter applicant, identified below, will be given fifteen (15) minutes to present information about its application.  

  • Global Leadership Academy International Charter High School

The Board of Education will receive public comment from Philadelphia residents on the charter application on December 20th.  Public comment shall start at approximately 4:30 p.m on the remote platform.  To register to speak, individuals must either call the speaker registration line at  215-400-5959 or email schoolboard@philasd.org by 5:00 pm EST on December 19th.   Individuals who timely register will be permitted to provide public comment on December 20th.   Each individual shall have two minutes to speak.    

The Board of Education also will accept written public testimony on the new charter application from Philadelphia residents through January 26, 2024 at 5:00 p.m. EST. 

Testimony may be submitted by mail or via email to schoolboard@philasd.org. 

If submitted by mail, written testimony must be postmarked by January 26, 2024 and addressed to:

Board of Education

The School District of Philadelphia

440 North Broad Street, Suite 101

Philadelphia, PA  19130

Regardless of submission method, all written testimony should include the full name and address of the sender in order to establish Philadelphia residency. Additionally, written testimony should clearly indicate the specific new charter application to which the testimony refers. All written testimony timely received by the Board of Education will be made part of the public record for the new charter application hearing.

Notice is hereby given that the Board of Education of The School District of Philadelphia (“School District”) shall hold a public hearing pursuant to the Charter School Law on an application for a new charter school in Philadelphia.  The hearing will be held on January 23, 2024 via remote platform.  The remote platform link will be posted on the Board of Education’s website at https://www.philasd.org/schoolboard/ the morning of each hearing.

The schedule for the hearing is as follows:

January 23,  2024:

2:00 pm – Global Leadership Academy International Charter High School

Public testimony will not be accepted during the hearing on January 23, 2024.  The Board of Education will accept written public testimony on the new charter application from Philadelphia residents through January 26, 2024 at 5:00 p.m. EST. 

Testimony may be submitted by mail or via email to schoolboard@philasd.org. 

If submitted by mail, written testimony must be postmarked by January 26, 2024 and addressed to:

Board of Education

The School District of Philadelphia

440 North Broad Street, Suite 101

Philadelphia, PA  19130


Regardless of submission method, all written testimony should include the full name and address of the sender, in order to establish Philadelphia residency. Additionally, written testimony should clearly indicate the specific new charter application to which the testimony refers. All written testimony timely received by the Board of Education will be made part of the public record for the respective new charter application hearing.
